title: Bayern Munich make new move to sign Leroy Sane from Man City
text:
Leroy Sane remains on Bayern Munich’s radar (Getty Images)

Bayern Munich have made a new move to sign Leroy Sane from Manchester City, according to reports in Germany.

As exclusively revealed by Metro.co.uk in August, City rejected a £72 million offer from Bayern for the 23-year-old.

Sane’s current contract with City expires in 2021 and the Premier League champions have offered him a new £180,000-a-week deal.

But City’s hierarchy fear that Sane’s head has been turned and the player is happy to run down his contract.

Sane is currently sidelined with a cruciate ligament injury (Getty Images)

According to SportBild, Bayern have made a fresh approach to Sane’s entourage since the summer transfer window closed.

Giovanni Branchini, who often acts as a negotiator on behalf of Bayern Munich, met with Sane’s agent last week during City’s 2-0 win over Dinamo Zagreb in the Champions League.

Sane is still recovering from surgery after tearing his cruciate ligament in the Community Shield win over Liverpool in August.

The Germany international, who was initially ruled out for seven months, is hopeful of featuring for City before the end of the season.
